intro: Cynoglossum stewartii, commonly known as Stewart's mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. It has a compact growth habit and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late summer. Cynoglossum stewartii is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a short-lived perennial.
